documentation.#text: Order data in XML format for new EBICS order types.

HAAResponseOrderData.description: Order data for order type HAA (response: receive downloadable order types).

HCARequestOrderData.description: Order data for order type HCA (request: replace user's keys for authentication and encryption).

HCSRequestOrderData.description: Order data for order type HCS (request: replace all keys).

HIARequestOrderData.description: Order data for order type HIA (request: initialise user's keys for authentication and encryption).

H3KRequestOrderData.description: Order data for order type H3K (request: initialise all three user's keys).

HKDResponseOrderData.description: Order data for order type HKD (response: receive customer-based information on the customer and the customer's users).

HKDAccountKey.description: Key for the identification of the account.

HKDAccountRef.description: Reference to the account identification keys.

HPBResponseOrderData.description: Order data for order type HPB (response: receive bank's public keys).

HPDResponseOrderData.description: Order data for order type HPD (response: receive bank parameters).

HTDResponseOrderData.description: Order data for order type HTD (response: receive user-based information on the user's customer and the user herself/himself).

HTDAccountKey.description: Key for the identification of the account.

HTDAccountRef.description: Reference to the account identification keys.

HVDResponseOrderData.description: Order data for order type HVD (response: receive the status of an order currently stored in the distributed signature processing unit).

HVSRequestOrderData.description: Order data for order type HVS (request: reject an order currently stored in the distributed signature processing unit).

allOf.description: Order data for order type HVT (response: receive transaction details of an order currently stored in the distributed signature processing unit).
Order data for order type HVT (response: receive transaction details of an order currently stored in the distributed signature processing unit).

HVTResponseOrderData.description: Order data for order type HVT (response: receive transaction details of an order currently stored in the distributed signature processing unit).

HVUResponseOrderData.description: Order data for order type HVU (response: receive summary of orders currently stored in the distributed signature processing unit).

HVZResponseOrderData.description: Order data for order type HVZ (response: receive summary of orders currently stored in the distributed signature processing unit with additional information).

OrderParams.description: additional order parameters required to execute the order.

allOf.description: Account number (German format or international as IBAN).

allOf.description: Data type for account information regarding order type HVT.

Type.description: Purpose: [object Object],[object Object]Details: [object Object],[object Object]Comment: [object Object],[object Object]

HVTOrderFlagsType.description: Offset position in the original order file which marks the starting point for the transaction details to be transmitted; applies to the sequential number of a particular order if completeOrderData=false (Proposal for Default=0).

completeOrderData.description: Are the transaction details so be transmitted as particular order content information requested for display matters or in complete order data file form? (Proposal for Default=false)

fetchLimit.description: Limit for the transaction details to be transmitted; if completeOrderData=false, maximum number of details of a particular order; 0 for unlimited number of details (Proposal for Default=100).

fetchOffset.description: Offset position in the original order file which marks the starting point for the transaction details to be transmitted; applies to the sequential number of a particular order if completeOrderData=false (Proposal for Default=0).

allOf.description: Special order flags for orders of type HVT.
Special order flags for orders of type HVT.

items.description: Generic key-value parameters

Service.description: Service name - target system for the further processing of the order

SignatureFlag.description:
If not present the order doesn't contain any ES and shall be authorised outside EBICS
If present the order shall be autorised within EBICS: 
1. If the attribute VEU is also present the sender desires spooling into the VEU - hence in this case the order is not rejected in the case of not sufficient number of ES
2. If the attribute is not present all necessary ES must be inside the order (else: rejection of the order)

fileName.description: The file name on the client It can be transmitted optionally

BTFParamsTyp.description: The file name on the client It can be transmitted optionally

Service.description: Service name - target system for the further processing of the order

SignatureFlag.description:
If not present the order doesn't contain any ES and shall be authorised outside EBICS
If present the order shall be autorised within EBICS: 
1. If the attribute VEU is also present the sender desires spooling into the VEU - hence in this case the order is not rejected in the case of not sufficient number of ES
2. If the attribute is not present all necessary ES must be inside the order (else: rejection of the order)

allOf.description: Encoding format of the message (e.g. XML, ASN1, JSON, PDF)

variant.description: Variant number of the message type (usable for ISO20022 messages)

version.description: Version number of the message type  (usable for ISO20022 messages)

format.description: Encoding format of the message (e.g. XML, ASN1, JSON, PDF)

MessageType.description: Encoding format of the message (e.g. XML, ASN1, JSON, PDF)

ServiceType.description: Name of the message, e.g. pain.001 or mt101 National message names (issued by DK, CFONB or SIC are also allowed)

ServiceName.description: Service Code name: External list specified and maintained by EBICS. Basis is the "SWIFT-list" for the field "description" (SCT, DCT, XCT, SDD, DDD, STM, REP...) plus additional codes needed for further services

Scope.description:
Specifies whose rules have to be taken into account for the service. This means which market / comminity has defined the rules. 
If the element is absent a global definition for the service is assumed.
External list specified and maintained by EBICS. In addition the following codes may be used:
2-character ISO country code or a 3-character issuer code (defined by EBICS)

ServiceOption.description:
Service Option Code
Additional option for the service (also depends on used scope)

Container.description: Container flag. If present, data is provided/requested in a container format specified in the attribute of the flag
